text: Posting Gnarly Space Facts Until I Run Out of Knowledge  Day   Aw yeah baby  it s that time again  If you have any questions about space or if you d like to submit a topic for a future fact  leave it in the comments  See ya tomorrow Fact   SpaceX are not the only space organization to have successfully landed and reused a spacecraft  In fact  depending on who you ask  they aren t even the first ones  Technically  NASA became the first people to successfully reuse a spacecraft with the Space Shuttle program  But  the Shuttle had to go through a months long process of checks and refurbishment before it could fly again  making it only  partially  reusable     So that must mean SpaceX were the first ones to make a  fully  reusable rocket  right  Well  it s complicated  Just a month before SpaceX landed their Falcon   for the first time  another space company called Blue Origin  owned by Jeff Bezos  successfully landed their New Shepard rocket and reused it without any refurbishment  becoming the first organization to successfully do so   However  New Shepard is a  suborbital  rocket  meaning it can get into space  but doesn t have the power to reach orbit  Therefore  SpaceX became the first organization to successfully create a  fully  reusable   orbital class  spacecraft  Which is still a massive feat  by the way  So although SpaceX may not be the first ones to land  let s be honest  They do it better than anyone else
summary: SpaceX is the first organization to successfully create a fully reusable orbital class spacecraft. Blue Origin owned by Jeff Bezos successfully landed their New Shepard rocket and reused it without any refurbishment making it the first time a space company has successfully done so.
cleaned: space organization successfully create fully reusable orbital class spacecraft blue origin own jeff bozos successfully land new shepard rocket reuse refurbishment make time space company successfully
